metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14734 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c in the Linux kernel through 4.17.11 allowsucma_leave_multicast to access a certain data structure after a cleanupstep in ucma_process_join, which allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice (use-after-free).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-138.164
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-138.164
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-138.164
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1099.107
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1103.108
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1070.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-43.46~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-43.46~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-43.46~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1036.38~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1026.27~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1036.42
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-138.164').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
